example.text: Bending of 31 into the major groove over the CC and CT base pair steps is able to promptly begin and end the CArG-box, and 15 into the minor groove over the five central TA, AA and AT base pair steps.
example.arg: bending of 31 into the major groove over the CC and CT base pair steps

example.text: Bending of 31 into the major groove over the CC and CT base pair steps will begin and end the CArG-box, and 15 into the minor groove over the five central TA, AA and AT base pair steps.
example.arg: bending of 31 into the major groove over the CC and CT base pair steps

example.text: The electron density of each of the four copies of the SRF polypeptide in the asymmetric unit beginning between amino acids 136 and 140 will continue to the C-terminus.
example.arg: The electron density of each of the four copies of the SRF polypeptide in the asymmetric unit

example.text: The electron density of each of the four copies of the SRF polypeptide in the asymmetric unit that has begun between amino acids 136 and 140 has continued to the C-terminus.
example.arg: The electron density of each of the four copies of the SRF polypeptide in the asymmetric unit

example.text: The electron density of each of the four copies of the SRF polypeptide in the asymmetric unit, as our data have shown, has begun between amino acids 136 and 140, and has continued to the C-terminus.
example.arg: The electron density of each of the four copies of the SRF polypeptide in the asymmetric unit

example.text: The electron density of each of the four copies of the SRF polypeptide in the asymmetric unit, as our data have shown, would begin variably between amino acids 136 and 140, and continued to the C-terminus.
example.arg: The electron density of each of the four copies of the SRF polypeptide in the asymmetric unit

example.text: The only transcript which, on the other hand, is believed to have begun at exon 1a is observed in normal cells.
The only transcript which, on the other hand, was believed to have begun at exon 1a is observed in normal cells.

Both SRF subunits in the ternary complex bend the two DNA half sites to the same extent, resulting in bending of 31 into the major groove over the CC and CT base pair steps beginning and ending the CArG-box, and 15 into the minor groove over the five central TA, AA and AT base pair steps.
example.arg: bending of 31 into the major groove over the CC and CT base pair steps

example.text: On the other hand, The electron density of each of the four copies of the SRF polypeptide in the asymmetric unit being believed to probably begin between amino acids 136 and 140 is observed in normal cells.
example.arg: The electron density of each of the four copies of the SRF polypeptide in the asymmetric unit

example.text: On the other hand, The electron density of each of the four copies of the SRF polypeptide in the asymmetric unit that could probably begin between amino acids 136 and 140 was observed in normal cells.
example.arg: The electron density of each of the four copies of the SRF polypeptide in the asymmetric unit

example.text: On the other hand, The electron density of each of the four copies of the SRF polypeptide in the asymmetric unit that is believed to have begun between amino acids 136 and 140 is observed in normal cells.
example.arg: The electron density of each of the four copies of the SRF polypeptide in the asymmetric unit

example.text: On the other hand, The electron density of each of the four copies of the SRF polypeptide in the asymmetric unit that is believed to probably begin between amino acids 136 and 140 is observed in normal cells.
example.arg: The electron density of each of the four copies of the SRF polypeptide in the asymmetric unit

example.text: On the other hand, The electron density of each of the four copies of the SRF polypeptide in the asymmetric unit which could begin between amino acids 136 and 140 was observed in normal cells.
example.arg: The electron density of each of the four copies of the SRF polypeptide in the asymmetric unit

example.text: The only transcript that, on the other hand, probably begins between amino acids 136 and 140 is observed in normal cells.
the only transcript, as our data have shown, would begin variably at exon 1a, and continued to the C-terminus.
